item.title: [DISTRELEC-6797] Customize Apache Proxy Error Page
item.description:
The apache proxy error page is not yet customised.

We should ad a simple Distrelec layout similar to the maintenance page.

status.description: Change Request/Bug was approved by customer, CR/Bug can be implemented/fixed

comments.comment: Please estimate, thx.
estimate done by Ruben

OPEN QUESTIONS:

  • new index.html under /project_distrelec/404-page/index.html okay?
  • normal page layout but without header and footer components okay (or design)?
    • there are no components available for this page. Just static data.
  • we need translated texts for this page
    • will be hardcoded (not in i18n properties)
    • sample text de and en: 
      <h1>
	Seite nicht gefunden <br/>
	Page not found
</h1>
<h2>

	Bitte entschuldigen Sie...
</h2>
<p>
	Bitte entschuldigen Sie, die gewünschte Webseite ist nicht verfügbar.
	<br/>
	<br/>
	Die Seite wurde vielleicht verschoben, gelöscht oder existiert nicht.
</p>
<h2>We're sorry...</h2>
<p>
	We are sorry, but the page you requested is not available.
	<br/>
	<br/>
	The page you are looking for may have been renamed, removed or deleted.</a>.
</p>

thats how it looks today:

the new page needs to be simple but a least have a distrelec logo.
error code is 502.

path on server, somethin like: /data/www/error/502_error.html

path in project:
/environment/env-d-common/unix/data/www/error/502_error.html
no translation needed, english is enough!

Layout ist gut.

Message:
Dear customer
Unfortunately we could complete you request. (Please try again later)
If the problem consist please contact customer support via:

  • webshopsupport@
  • +41 555 5555 55555

Detailed Error Messages:
<original message>

@Oana

Can you please review the my message proposal?

@Simon

Layout ist gut.

Noch ein kleiner fehler:

  • Ausrichtung vom text ist noch nicht ganz korrekt.
implemented similar to the maintenance page
change text and list alignment for error and maintenance pages.

Dear customer

Unfortunately we could complete you request. (Please try again later)
If the problem consist please contact customer support via: webshop.support@distrelec.com

Detailed Error Messages:
wait for deploy

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6345] Products not online
item.description:
Hi Florian,
I have realized there are some accessories missing in the web shop, but the articles are delivered by PIM.
On Article 912056 there are listed just 3 articles as accessories, delivered from PIM are 8.

Listed:
917158
972530
912336

Delivered:
918092
918151
970619
16925259
910446
912324

I think there are a lot of more articles with missing accessories, how can we figure out which those are?

BR, Patrick

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi Nabil
Could you please check why the other accessories are not displayed?
Thx.

With the same product locally and on Q I can see the "Show more" button but on P. Note that locally and on Q we have v3.2 however on P we have v3.1. We should check this after the next P deployment of v3.2.

Please check after P deployment.
Thx.
Hi Patrick, please check again as we had another P deployment, thx.

Hi Rafael, on this article the situation is still same, just 3 articles are listed as accessories.
BR; Patrick

Hi Patrick,

have you checked if these accessories are all buyable ? I think the reason is that some of them are not buyable. Please check. Thx.

Hi Nabil,

With one exception all mentioned articles are buyable and have an active status in ERP system. Exception is 16925259.

Kinds, Patrick

Hi Patrick,

For the accessories, we load only 4 products (but we show only 3) at product page load, the rest is loaded asynchronously when the customer clicks on the "show more" link. However, since one of the 4 loaded product is not buyable then it returns only 3, thus, it consider that there is no more products. I adjusted the query to consider only the buyable products during the load of the 4 first products.

BR,
Nabil.
Thank you Nabil.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7030] Transform the "Omega"-sign to the term "Ohm¨ with new WEBSITETEST
item.description:
The "Ohm"-sign is probablly not correctly converted into Ohm in the export with Websitetest:

step://product?versionid=trendsVersionCHD&id=di01725113&editor=Product&workspaceid=Approved&contextid=CH-ger-Dis

Ends up like this in the FF feed:
--> |Nennleistung~W=0.5|Temperaturkoeffizientppm/Â°C=100|Toleranz%=1|Widerstand~Î©=560|

Maybe - if there is nothing to be found - it's an issue between Hybris & FF, which Will would have to check.
item.summary: Transform the "Omega"-sign to the term "Ohm¨ with new WEBSITETEST

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:

Data from PIM are coming correctly:

<MultiValue AttributeID="nennleistung_emb_W">
<Value UnitID="unece.unit.WTT" InheritedFrom="230506"><prefix> </prefix> 0.5<suffix> @ 70 °C</suffix></Value>
</MultiValue>

May I kindly ask you to have a look on the interface between hybris and ff?

Thank you very much.

Regards, Patrick

I will run the PIM import on my local env over the night to check the issue with "Ohm":

            <Value AttributeID="producthierarchy_num">155200</Value>

I did not see any conversion of the value in the PIM importer. We just set the value like this:

target.setPimWebUseA03(source.valueOf(XP_FF_WEBUSE_A_03), importContext.getLocale());

Why we have the special "ohm" character in hybris Q I dont know yet.

Cheers
Will

Hi all

There is a special flag which needs to be set to true in the HAC when importing the DQS data. I didnt know about it. We set this flag now to true and restarted the the PIM import. I will check status on friday 19.07.2015 and update the ticket.

Cheers
Will

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7029] Replacement of ... with â€¦
item.description:
In the current AT-DQ feed, "..." are replaced with the string "â€¦". In Hybris the data still looks normal (so does it in PIM, too), but in the FF feed this string pops up. In FF it's converted to a ?

An example:

ID 11035715 on Q:
http://test.distrelec.at/de/werkzeuge-messtechnik/werkzeuge/handwerkzeuge/zangen/abisolierzangen/abisolierzange-1182130/c/cat-345878?q=*&filter_productFamilyCode=cat-345878

On P, the same data works fine: http://www.distrelec.ch/de/werkzeuge-messtechnik/werkzeuge/handwerkzeuge/zangen/abisolierzangen/abisolierzange-1182130/c/cat-345878?q=*&filter_productFamilyCode=cat-345878

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Daniela

Strange finding. Maybe there is anywhere a conversion... I will check this next week.

Cheers
Will

Wir haben festgestellt das bei folgendem Produkt das Attribut „Abisolierquerschnitt“ falsch im FF Q AT DE channel falsch dargestellt wird:

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7000] Filter information in the wrong field in Hybris
item.description:
We have data in the pimWebUseC04 field in Hybris, which is intended to be in the pimSearchField13.

The data is coming from the PIM field ff_filter_output13_txt. Maybe it has to be checked if the field has to be moved from the search section in Hybris to the filter section or if there is a change in PIM needed.

E.g. product 16926649
item.summary: Filter information in the wrong field in Hybris

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Daniela

I will check this issue today.

Cheers
Will

Hi Daniela

Just to be sure, the data from pimWebUseC04 has to be moved to pimSearchField13. right?

Thx
Will

No. Data from the field with the attributeID=ff_filter_output13_txt have to be mapped with pimSearchField13 in Hybris.

Does this clarify it?

/Daniela

Hi Daniela

Thx. Yes I will check & update it accordingly.

Cheers
Will

Hi Patrick

We found a problem with the attribute "ff_search_output13_txt". It is not in the last DQ PIM file, but in our PIM import job it is defined.The only attribute i found searching for "output13" in the PIM file is:

    <Attribute ID="ff_filter_output13_txt" MultiValued="false" ProductMode="Normal" FullTextIndexed="false" ExternallyMaintained="true" Derived="false" Referenced="true">
      <Name>Filter/Search 13</Name>
      <Validation BaseType="text" MinValue="" MaxValue="" MaxLength="" InputMask=""/>
      <MetaData>
        <MultiValue AttributeID="usage_in_e_platform_lov">
          <Value>Distrelec FACT-Finder</Value>
        </MultiValue>
        <Value Derived="true" AttributeID="CalcColHead">Filter/Search 13</Value>
      </MetaData>
      <AttributeGroupLink AttributeGroupID="00570_ff_display"/>
      <UserTypeLink UserTypeID="DI01_Article"/>
    </Attribute>

But this ff_filter_output13_txt attribute we dont use in our PIM import.

Can we quickly discuss this issue together?

Thx, Will

Hi Will,

The field have the ID "ff_filter_output13_txt".

Thanks, Patrick
Changed mapping for pimSearchField13 in PIM import from ff_search_output13_txt to ff_filter_output13_txt. Commit to trunk. Ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6880] Availability link
item.description:
Requirement
URL: http://www.distrelec.de/en/productinfo?p=17694045
If the above URL is entered, the stock of the different Warehouses of all countries and their delivery time to the active country should be listed.

For example:
Article Number: 101010

Stock CH: 7
Availability: 24 h

Stock NL: 29
Availability: 72 h

Original Email
Für einen großen umsatzstarken Kunden in der Schweiz müssten Lagerwerte und Lieferzeiten über einen Link abgerufen werden können.

Umgesetzt haben wir einen solchen Link schon einmal für das Lager in NL mit 8stelligen Artikelnummern für den deutschen Markt.

Beispiel: http://www.distrelec.de/en/productinfo?p=17694045

Nun ist die Frage, können wir einen solchen Link kurzfristig mit 6stelligen Artikelnummern (ab 01.2016 mit 8stelligen) für CH bereitstellen?

Inhalt (genaue Spezifikation würde ggfs. folgen):

Article Number: 101010

Stock CH: 7
Availability: 24 h

Stock NL: 29
Availability: 72 h

Ich bitte um eine grundsätzliche Information zur Machbarkeit und ggfs. die Umsetzungsdauer.

Requestor:
i.A. Angela Titz

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: e-mail forwarded to R. Burlet and D Froidevaux.
Hi Surendra, please estimate, thx.
please estimate

Copy this method and extend it, to use all CMSSites and not only the current one (ProductPageController.java):

    @RequestMapping(method = RequestMethod.GET)
    public String productInformation(@RequestParam(value = PRODUCT_INFORMATION_QUERY_PARAMETER_NAME, required = true)
    final String searchQuery, final Model model, final HttpServletRequest request) {
        if (StringUtils.isNumeric(searchQuery)) {
            final ProductModel productModel = getProductService().getProductForCode(searchQuery);
            if (productModel != null && StringUtils.isNotBlank(productModel.getCode())) {
                final List<ProductAvailabilityData> availabilityData = getProductFacade().getAvailability(Collections.singletonList(productModel.getCode()),
                        Boolean.FALSE);
                if (CollectionUtils.isNotEmpty(availabilityData)) {
                    final ProductAvailabilityData productAvailabilityData = availabilityData.get(0);
                    model.addAttribute("articleNumber", searchQuery);
                    model.addAttribute("deliveryTime", productAvailabilityData.getStatusLabel());
                    model.addAttribute("stock", productAvailabilityData.getStockLevelTotal());
                    addGlobalModelAttributes(model, request);
                    return ControllerConstants.Views.Pages.Product.ProductInformationPage;
                }
            }
        }
        return REDIRECT_PREFIX + "/notFound";
    }

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6817] Change Category Page | Create DistrelecCategoryGridComponent
item.description:
Idea:

  • Redesign of the Category Page
  • Create DistrelecCategoryGridComponent based on new design and make it available for content pages

Requirements for Category Page redesign:

  1. Remove octagon shapes
  2. Add attached background image (png) behind the current content
  3. Keep using the same category thumbnails and category titles that are used right now
  4. Mouse over one of the category boxes should trigger a grey overlay with small amount of opacity

Requirements for DistrelecCategoryGridComponent:

  1. This new design should come as a DistrelecCategoryGridComponent that can be used on any content page
  2. The component can be used in 100% width (961px) or 66% width (641px)
  3. The component is filled up in the following two ways:
    • By choosing a category ID - Then the category thumbnail, the category title and the desination URL (category page) are added automatically
    • By manually adding an image (75x100px), a title and a destination URL
    • Special case: If we choose a category ID to add the content automatically but manually add another image and/or title and/or URL those entries should be used and overwrite the automated content

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Requirement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
hi Rafael,

the action of this button is "Add to Cart". Generally along the webshop, this action don't redirect to the Cart Page. It just add the products to the cart.

Do you want to change this behavior for this particular case (import tool) ?

Thanks!

Hi Ruben

can you fill me in what is your question here? maybe I can fill in for Rafael on this one.

thanks

Hi Oana,

Along the webshop, the button Add to Cart, triggers an ajax call to add item/s to the Cart.
When we click this button, it does not open the Cart page itself. Instead, it adds +1 products to the cart box at the top right on the screen.
The the user can decide to click on the box to go to Cart page, or continue adding products to the cart.

What you want in this ticket is to change the general behavior of this button. Which can be done, but it won't follow the general rule

Hope my explanation helps
all good now. I checked with Rafael, and he is right, in this case, the cart page should open.

Requirement: The Button behavior should be changed ONLY for this case(Importtool).
For the rest it stays like it is.
Please test after the next deployment

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6657] EX - Checkout
item.description:
General

  • SAP: Prepayment orders will be handled manually by customer-service, notification-email for customer service needs to be sent from SAP.
  • New CR: If a customer wants to deliver via EXW then he is prompted to add a mobile or phone number to the contact/order.

Guest-Customer

  • Decision: Only available for B2C channel
  • Payment-methods: Only CreditCard & PayPal
  • Guests can only purchase in the export shops default currency (EURO)
  • Customers are charged with Dutch tax
    Warning-message at checkout Step 3 (only for EU): “Dutch VAT is being charged on the order.”

Registered-Customer

  • Billing-/Shipping-addresses: The initially registered country of the customer can’t be changed. Deliveries to other countries than the original one is not allowed (only possible via customer service).
  • Payment:
    • PayPal, CreditCard
    • Prepaid-Invoice (New order-type will be delivered from SAP)
    • Invoice (Needs activation from customer service)
    • Warning should be shown in the checkout(Step 2) to the customers:
      “ If you are interested to get credit for your purchases, please contact us directly:
      Email: export@elfa.se | Phone: +46 8 58094230 ”
    • Warning should be shown at checkout step 3(EU-only): “Dutch VAT is charged on the order if you didn’t provided a valid VAT-ID for.”
  • “Open-Order” functionality for at least 1 week.
  • Web CR: Add a text component to the check out process step 1(delivery terms) with the following information:
    • EXW conditions (Pickup)
    • Dangerous good condition DISTRELEC-6658
    • Bulky/freight item conditions

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate, you can come back to me if something is unclear. Thx

- Payment-methods: Only CreditCard & PayPal

- Customers are charged with Dutch tax
Warning-message at checkout Step 3 (only for EU): “Dutch VAT is being charged on the order.”

Registered-Customer

- Billing-/Shipping-addresses: The initially registered country of the customer can’t be changed. Deliveries to other countries than the original one is not allowed (only possible via customer service).
- Payment:
– PayPal, CreditCard
– Prepaid-Invoice (New order-type will be delivered from SAP)
– Invoice (Needs activation from customer service)
– Warning should be shown in the checkout(Step 2) to the customers:
“ If you are interested to get credit for your purchases, please contact us directly:
Email: export@elfa.se | Phone: +46 8 58094230 ”
– Warning should be shown at checkout step 3(EU-only): “Dutch VAT is charged on the order if you didn’t provided a valid VAT-ID for.”

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6342] Alternative to No results if the wrong category is selected
item.description:
If the wrong category is selected for a search query, you get zero results. Costumers should not need to know to which category a product is assigned.

Therefore, if a category is selected which has no results for a search query, the shop should perform the same query in “all” categories and show all the results with the following text above results, as in the screenshot: No results found in category “xyz”
(rough mockup see screenshot III)

If not technically possible or too much effort, we should find an alternative.
item.summary: Alternative to No results if the wrong category is selected

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6665] IT - External vendors should not be shown
item.description:
There is a problem in Italy with IT-products availability:
If local supplier is 0, currently the CH external vendor availability is shown. Most times local product version are different so it is not possible to buy in another country. So we want that in this case availability shown is 0.

Q/A

  1. Q: What options do we have to avoid showing products in the IT-category as available if they anyway can't/shouldn't be bought in the local country?
    • A: We can use the SalesOrg-Product relationship, i.e., a product is buyable on shop XX if there exist a relationship between the salesOrg and the product, otherwise we can't see it on that shop.
  2. Q: Do we have other options to solve the problem than playing with the availability-logic?
    • A:
item.summary: IT - External vendors should not be shown

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: Please give some insights, thx.

Please provide some examples. Thanks

/Nabil
Waiting on answer from IT.

for example article 764560. Below you can see that:

  • Local supplier (Esprinet) availability is 0 (first image);
  • CH warehouse availability is 31 pcs (second image);
  • Italian shop availability is 31 pcs (third image).

Please see attached screenshots.
Needs to be discussed with Rafael. I will setup a meeting now.
High level estimate of 4h added for investigation.
